reviews.text: This place is solid. I went for dinner once and I enjoyed it very much. Brunch however was a little trickier. The food delicious was room temperature. It felt like they prepared food and kept it under the lights for a little too long. I was starving so I ate it all anyway. They offered to make me another plate and charged me full price for it? Thought that was weird. But the food is good! I just couldnâ€™t give it all stars. Hopefully itâ€™s something theyâ€™ll pay closer attention to. Brunch tends to be a lot more difficult to manage at a lot of places Iâ€™m not quite sure why ? Maybe thatâ€™s why they need to prep in advance?
Very underwhelming and over priced. Not that flavorful

Extremely kind waiter Luisâ€¦
Recommending an excellent champagne w/his recommendation and  attentive service we had a delightful experience.

Cameron was our host  she was so welcoming. She walked us through  the food choices nicely.

Food : gotta try the truffle eggs
Try the escargo  (this was amazing)
Every thing seems prepared  fresh.
Im definitely coming back here with friends.
Enjoyed brunch with my wife. We both loved the experience.
Every corner of this restaurant shows quality. The portion wasn't too small or too large. This restaurant's atmosphere stands out. The team shows remarkable customer care. We'll be back before long.
Great food, very busy with nice vibe. Would definitely go back.
Not bad at all but super busy on a Saturday and donâ€™t get our food for a while. The spritz was super tasty though!

The food was as good as ever, but this time the overall experience was disappointing. The worst part was that my daughterâ€™s crÃªpe included a type of meat she doesnâ€™t eat â€” which was upsetting, as it could just as easily have been an ingredient sheâ€™s allergic to. Iâ€™m not sure where the mix-up happened, but considering that we had to get up to find sugar for our coffee, and that a pen nearly ended up in our orange juice, I have my suspicions. In any case, her originally ordered omelette only arrived once the rest of our party had finished eating.
Great experience, Sophia very attentive and helpful! Thank you
Nice atmosphere
Sophia was an amazing waitress for us! A kind and considerate woman.
Service was great. Luis took care of us flawlessly
Great food and great server (Marco)!
I have brunch here most Saturdays. Marco was our waiter today as he has been many time. Heâ€™s unfailingly polite, efficient and an all around pleasant person. Cheers to Marco!! 6 Stars!!
Marco was fantastic,  helpful, fast and such a pleasant experience! He was so busy, but still  helped to take pictiure of our family ğŸ˜Š
Our server Sofia was great!!!
It was a great experience! Sophia served us swiftly, was polite and friendly.
I had an amazing meal for my birthday! The salmon and the chocolate lava cake were fantastic. Louis was an amazing server!

Pleasant, casual atmosphere. We were never rushed, the waiters were attentive and the food was delicious. I had the organic roast chicken, my aunt had eggs Benedict and her aide had a stuffed crepe. The dishes were carefully and attractively prepared. We shared the chocolate mousse with whipped cream. We will be back!
service was so slow even though there were plenty of workers available
Luis provided outstanding service during lunch. Extremely attentive and showed great care.
Our server Sofia was excellent!
Great place, great atmosphere. We had brunch with bottomless mimosas and great service by Luis and Catherine. 100% recommend!

The place serves excellent food. I went for brunch and ordered the bottomless mimosas, which were fantastic. Luis and his colleague, Catherine, were so welcoming and friendly. I highly recommend Le Monde.
Luis and Katherine were amazing servers! Love coming here!!!!

It was such a delightful brunch (the truffles eggs were delicious, and the Tarte fine aux pommes exquisite!). The experience wouldn't have been the same without the kindness of the server: Sofia was absolutely lovely!

I believe our server was Louis. Everything was perfect. Very authentic, delicious food, beautiful ambiance (French doors open to the street) and impeccable service. I would highly recommend Le Monde. The Parisian modules frites was out of this world and so was the Caesar salad. Perfect evening
Schmeckt super, ganz frisch. Personal sind freundlich. Insgesamt sogar besser als in Paris
Came here for a date night and it was  wonderful dinner out!! Delicious food and drinks in a great atmosphere. The pear margarita was incredible!! And our waitress Sophia took great care of us.

The food was SO TASTY. We got a crepe, chicken sandwich, tea, and coffee. Such fresh, high-quality ingredients in truly scrumptious combinations. Gorgeous outdoor seating and cute vibe inside too. Great service from our waitress Sofia. Will return!
The food was excellentâ€”serving size wasnâ€™t overly filling and well priced. We received excellent service from Marco!
Luis was great and super on top of the bottomless!
Marco was our Server, extremely kind, fast service, and good food.
Luis was an amazing server and we loved the food. He was super attentive and food was fast and tasted good
Gavin was our server and he was amazing! The food and atmosphere are incredible, but the service sold the experience.
Brunch was delicious! Our server (Gavin!) was attentive and very kind â˜ºï¸ would recommend!
Amazing brunch, Marco was amazing the bottomless mimosas were delicious
Jason is a fantastic waiter. Give him a raise. Also marko is the goat
Luis was awesome!
Perfect customer service received, thank you Luiz
The food was amazing and our friend Luise was very nice and helped us with everything.
Sofia was wonderful and the meals are so unique. will be coming back again, hope to see Sofia again!
Sofia and the team were so kind and provided amazing service for my solo lunch : )

I hosted an event here and the place, food and service were excellent.
Khalid, the manager, explained and coordinated the event with me. He was prompt, responsive and delivered an awesome service ğŸ™‚
I'm thankful for every staff involved in hosting such a great event. Highly recommended!
Erik is the best waiter!!!! TE AMAMOSS
Great service!! Luis was on itâ€¦made our first experience amazing at Le Monde!
Truly loved my experience here. Great food. I had the smoked salmon omelette and peach cobbler dessert. The ambiance was lovely. And the service was great too.

We came for brunch with our 5-year-old daughter, and it was a great experience.  From the start we were warmly welcomed, service was outstanding and food really good. Our server, Sofia, did an amazing job to recommend the best dishes, very attentive to all our requests and absolutely sweet to our daughter. Super recommend!

Review: A Sublime French Dining Experience in New York

If youâ€™re dreaming of a night that feels like a chic stroll down a Parisian boulevard, this New York French spot delivers, with a warmth and finesse that makes you feel instantly at home.

Ambience
Design:** Elegant, timeless, with soft lighting and tasteful art that whispers â€œbonsoirâ€ rather than shouting it. The dining room has a refined, intimate feelâ€”perfect for a date night or a celebratory dinner.
Atmosphere:** Quiet enough to carry conversation, yet lively enough to remind you youâ€™re in the heart of the city. The clink of crystal and the gentle hum of guests create an authentic French bistro vibe.

Service
Wait staff:** The standout feature. Attentive without being overbearing, genuinely hospitable, and impeccably knowledgeable about the menu. Our server anticipated needs before we even realized themâ€”refilling water glasses right as they approached and offering thoughtful wine pairings.
Timing:** Courses arrived with pristine pacing, allowing us to savor each dish without feeling rushed. The team checked in at just the right momentsâ€”present when needed, invisible when not.

Cuisine
Appetizers:** A refined starter selection that showcases freshness and balance. The escargots were garlicky and tender, while the tartare showed a perfect kiss of citrus brightness.
Mains:** The seafood dish was a standoutâ€”delicately seasoned, with the right textural contrast. The duck confit melted on the palate, paired with a subtly spiced sauce that elevated the dish without overpowering it.
Desserts:** A Parisian finale in miniatureâ€”the chocolate mille-feuille had crisp layers and a velvety ganache, and the crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e had a caramelized top that crackled just as it should.
Wine list:** Thoughtfully curated, with a strong French section and a few well-chosen imports from nearby regions. The sommelierâ€™s recommendations perfectly complemented each course.

Highlights
The attention to detail extended to the table settings and bread service. A warm, crusty baguette with a lightly salted butter set the tone for the meal.
The staffâ€™s enthusiasm for the restaurantâ€™s storyâ€”its origin, its inspirationsâ€”added a personal touch that felt rare and special.

Value
While the dining experience leans upscale, the quality, craftsmanship, and service justify the price. Itâ€™s a memorable night out that feels both luxurious and accessible with the right occasion.
Dr Debby Smith
Marco was greatğŸ™

Went to have breakfast with my daughter and the egg Benedict were exquisite, fresh orange juice omg, the Nutella crepes and cappuccino were all delicious! Will definitely come back! Marco was a joy, I always say that the most important part of having a good meal is service and Marco made it happen!

I think everyone should try the escargot â€” it was absolutely outstanding and has now become my favorite dish. The service was excellent, and our server was very polite and professional. I would like to sincerely thank ğŸ©µSOFIA ğŸ©µfor her kind attention.ğŸ‰

The best Sunday brunch Iâ€™ve had in years, perfect place, perfect setting, it was a date brunch with my wife, and she was super happy at this place.
The staff ever so warm and helpful to explain to us the different dishes that we were enquiring about.
The food par excellence.

Our server Jason was amazing. The food incredible. Was our first time here  and will define be back. Thank you Le Monde for the amazing brunch. We had the Crab Lobster Benedict and Shakshuka which are incredible!

We had a wonderful Easter and Birthday meal on Easter Sunday. Everything was perfect. Jason was our host and did an outstanding job. We were visiting our son and his girlfriend and it was my hubby's birthday as well. The food was amazing and the service was outstanding! We will return hopefully the next time and will ask for Jason again. If you haven't been go check out this restaurant. We sat outside and the weather was perfect!

My friend recommended Le Monde for my graduation lunch and it did not disappoint. I loved everything I ordered: French onion soup, ham and egg crepe, chocolate cake, and a spritz to drink. The vibe was warm and celebratory. The place was busy and my party felt a bit rushed by the staff, but it did not detract too much from the experience. They were able to squeeze us in before our reservation, which was greatly appreciated.

I love going to Le Mondeâ€”it feels just like stepping into a neighborhood restaurant in France. The food is always delicious, and the atmosphere is warm and casual, which I really enjoy. Especially the mussels were really good so we ordered baguette to eat the broth. Freshly baked baguette was really good with the broth. But The fish wasnâ€™t very fresh, so it had a slightly fishy smell. The short rib was really tender and flavorful and fries were really crispy. The texture of noodles served with short rib were soft and great with short ribâ€™s sauce.
Duck hash for Sunday lunch was also great. Perfectly cooked and perfectly seasoned well. I loved it.

The servers are always friendly and welcoming. But Iâ€™ll never forget this one handsome young guy who served us onceâ€”he was chewing gum the entire time! He was witty and kind, but from start to finish, he never stopped chewing gum. I donâ€™t think thatâ€™s appropriate behavior when serving customers at a restaurant.

Had dinner with my ladies book club and had a great time. Jason was our server and he could not been more accommodating. Hamburguer, raviolies and desserts were delicious. Love the decor and light inside restaurant.
Sophia was a really great host to us! We had the Belgian Waffle and savory crÃ©pes and they were amazing! We would definitely come here again!
Food was great. Service was a bit slow but servers were nice. We were celebrating two birthdays and they brought us complimentary champagne and an extra dessert. Will absolutely come back.

I recently went here for a lunch with coworkers and our server Jason was amazing.  He offered recommendations on what to get and was very helpful.

I ordered the steak frites and the vanilla creme brulee and they were excellent !

I would definitely recommend this spot.

Very pleasant experience! We came super hungry after a walk around Columbiaâ€™s campus and needed a warm and nice place to eat. The salads were fresh, and the escargot and crepes were tasty. Our server Eric was very friendly and gave us good recommendations and was very patient.

My girlfriend recommended this place and itâ€™s Absolutely stunning, the cafe straight up feels like A portal to Paris, the atmosphere, the service and the food are perfect, would absolutely recommend it:D

Visited this restaurant in the evening for dinner on a Sunday and it was packed. We reserved a table for 7.45pm but when we arrived at 7.50pm the table was just being prepared. The waiters were rather overwhelmed while we were there - with us allegedly having an appointed server but we only saw him twice in our entire time there. For the most part, we had to ask for service from other servers. Would suggest to avoid peak hours for a better experience. The food was delicious though!

It was relatively quiet in a Friday summer evening when the local university was on break & all the locals are out of town. This charming bistro was perfect for a dinner. We had bottle of wine and a few apps (dinner tapas style) to celebrate a birthday. The tuna tartare and foie gras were good. The goat cheese and potato Tarte was forgettable. And Iâ€™ve had better watermelon salad. The presentation of the dishes were spot on. We had a delicious creme brÃ»lÃ©e with a candle to close out our dinner. Service was good. Jun 2025

Atmosphere upscale yet relaxed. Our server,Sofia and Jaime was gracious, helpful and efficient. There is outside seating and I recommend sitting on 112th side rather than Broadway . Inside is cozy. Food was delicious and the menu is varied and creative.#restaurantweek
Had a really nice experience here! The steak was juicy and tender. The crepes exceeded all expectations. Sofia was friendly and helpful.

This is my second time here at this cozy little French restaurant. I got to experience some of their lunch/dinner cuisine this time instead of brunch.
The honey thyme lemonade was refreshing and had a nice little zing to it that's to the sprig of thyme in it ğŸŒ¿
The raviollini gratinee was *chef's kiss* ğŸ‘ŒğŸ¾It was a nice light cheesy amalgamation with the soft cushiony ravioli pasta. I asked the waiter for some croutons to make it even more perfect. I didn't finish it only because I wanted to save room for the main course ğŸ˜‹
The coq au vin was delightful~ So packed with flavor and piping hot to boot. The chicken was so tender and the vegetables were succulent. The brine (gravy?) had a lot of flavor profiles in it, but I could point tone that reminded me of liquor. Like a wine? Some kind of cooking alcohol perhaps. It stood out to me, but I was still able to stomach half of the stew before I got full. The mashed potatoes were so little and creamy like a little palette cleanser. The bread that came with the meal was delicious all by itself, it must be homemade and fresh.
I was very happy to have returned here, I most definitely will come back again another day. Perhaps for the Summer restaurant week towards the end of July! ğŸ˜ğŸ™ğŸ¾

Ali was an ultimate pleasure. Outstanding service, made my wife & I feel at home and it was out first time at Le Monde. We even had a pleasant conversation about our watches and horology. Will definitely come again.

The service was excellent, but the food was mediocre.

As a first-time visitor, I recommend ordering steak frites, which is a safe bet at any restaurant.

I have to say this place just looked welcoming and on my first day on the new job it was a splendid treat to walk in, get seated, order and dine on what was a very tasty and well prepared meal!

It's by no means a quick meal but worth every minute and penny. The staff and service here was great and I couldn't have asked for more.
Great atmosphere, super friendly staff. The sauces and salad dressing are next level.  Already planning our next visit!

The atmosphere was perfect, cozy, and inviting, with just the right balance of elegance and comfort. The staff was friendly, attentive, and made sure we felt welcome from the moment we walked in.

However, the wait for our food was a different story. Despite the excellent service in terms of hospitality, it took an unusually long time for the duck meat to arrive. I understand that quality takes time, but the extended delay left us a bit frustrated.

This place absolutely deserves its rating! We went for brunch on a Saturday morning, and everything we ordered was delicious. The 1-hour unlimited mimosa offering during brunch was a great bonus â€” totally worth it! Our server Mr. Ali, took such great care of us and made the experience even more enjoyable. Big thanks to him for the warm hospitality!

Absolutely loved Jason and Chance! They were absolutely lively and attentive despite the busy Sunday crowd. 10/10 my new brunch spot. Come here for endless Bellinis and mimosas they will treat you right.

Dining at Le Monde in New York was one of the best restaurant experiences weâ€™ve ever had, and the credit goes first and foremost to Marco, our incredible waiter. From the moment we sat down, Marco made us feel welcome, relaxed, and completely taken care of. He wasnâ€™t just attentiveâ€”he anticipated what we needed, guided us through the menu with ease, and added a warmth that turned a great lunch into something unforgettable.

We came all the way from Florida because we knew exactly what we wanted: the duck. Itâ€™s usually only available at dinner, but Marco didnâ€™t let that be an obstacle. He immediately spoke with Chef JosÃ© Luis, who went out of his way to prepare the dish specially for us at lunch. That extra effort meant the world to usâ€”it showed just how much this team values their guests.

The duck was every bit as exquisite as we remembered: tender, flavorful, and plated beautifully. Marcoâ€™s genuine care, paired with Chef JosÃ© Luisâ€™s willingness to go above and beyond, gave us a mealâ€”and a memoryâ€”weâ€™ll be talking about for years.

If you want more than just a meal but a true experience where youâ€™re treated like family, ask for Marco at Le Monde. Heâ€™s the kind of waiter who turns dining into a celebration.

Le Monde has the true spirit of a French brasserie. It instantly takes me back to the restaurants I used to visit as a child in Paris. The service is always excellent, with staff who are attentive, thoughtful, and genuinely kind. The food never disappoints and every visit has been consistently good. Even the little details stand out since the restrooms are always clean, which is something I appreciate. It is a place I continue to return to with my mom, both for the great experience and for the way it reminds us of Paris. I truly recommend it. And Luis is the best Server!!!!!

Here I had a very tasty brunch with my friends and family! I ordered crepes with smoked salmon, Swiss cheese and spinach, they served it with poached egg and salad on the side. Service was top notch thanks to La Shawny! I hope Iâ€™m spelling it correctly ğŸ˜… but very kind gentleman! Thank you for wonderful brunch I had here! :)

Iâ€™ve been to NYC for three weeks and have been to this place 5 times already. I love it here. French bistro food perfectly done and at a reasonable price. Louise the waiter is the very best. Ive had the steak frites, roast chicken, salmon, flatbread, soufflÃ©s and Caesar salad. For me the roast chicken and Caesar are top drawer and I love their wine by the glass list. Just a treat of a place.

Hope you are lucky enough to get Jason as your server turning a good meal great with attentive service and great suggestions. Hamburger to risotto to the chocolate mousse-suggestions were spot on.
Edited 9/6 to encourage you to once more to find yourself sitting at a table here having a drink and dinner. Tried new menu items and were pleased with both! We'll be back!
Very quaint French bistro restaurant just a few blocks south of Columbia University. Service was great. Ordered the blueberry pancakes.

We sat at the bar with my friend for dinner and received excellent service. We ordered from the Restaurant Week menu and also added the octopus and shrimp. We absolutely loved the shrimp. For dessert, we had the apple tart, which was served warm with ice cream on top. Everything was amazing. Many thanks to bartender Ali for giving us such a wonderful experience.
